elements.2211.03267_33e6526e8587a2e044362290fe3c2: Embodied Instruction Following (EIF) studies how mobile manipulator robots should be controlled to accomplish long-horizon tasks specified by natural language instructions
elements.2211.03267_00dc417fddbc1939bdd5b8a2d6b6b: While most research on EIF are conducted in simulators, the ultimate goal of the field is to deploy the agents in real life
elements.2211.03267_294ae41349a1ce0ed9570914f0388: As such, it is important to minimize the data cost required for training an agent, to help the transition from sim to real
elements.2211.03267_39e2f65810799887804d9333e8c3f: However, many studies only focus on the performance and overlook the data cost- modules that require separate training on extra data are often introduced without a consideration on deployability
elements.2211.03267_d8610ab96c67c733280b29d5b02d4: In this work, we propose FILM++ which extends the existing work FILM
elements.2211.03267_01d6dd7561ebef3c4d1b75ef6c954: with modifications that do not require extra data
elements.2211.03267_cff4ec50feb4318d741708b00ab25: While all data-driven modules are kept constant, FILM++ more than doubles FILM's performance
elements.2211.03267_67b30d1398cb1c258944ef14822b1: Furthermore, we propose Prompter, which replaces FILM++'s semantic search module with language model prompting
elements.2211.03267_90b1c6c1cf163b45eb20130814e61: Unlike FILM++'s implementation that requires training on extra sets of data, no training is needed for our prompting based implementation while achieving better or at least comparable performance
elements.2211.03267_c30f4c9e3eca4e5abeb08579801a5: on the ALFRED benchmark with high-level instructions only and with step-by-step instructions, respectively, outperforming the previous state of the art by 6.57
elements.2211.03267_ce8a5558ca5928725143948fe9fa5: Creation of sentient agents that can follow language instructions has long been one of mankindâs dreams
elements.2211.03267_9e5ba5351ec681302b64f7ed64c7d: Embodied Instruction Following (EIF) studies just that- mobile agents are given natural language instructions of tasks that they are expected to complete
elements.2211.03267_7f42d9f93974592b0cd792493d4bc: However, converting free-form language instructions to step-by-step robot controls is no easy task, as agents must integrate information of multiple modalities while operating in environments full of uncertainties
elements.2211.03267_843a81e1ecd81e821e415f4b430ae: While most EIF research are conducted in simulators for quick and fair evaluations, the ultimate goal of EIF is to deploy agents in real life
elements.2211.03267_696a016abc041d187785bd17f78e4: In addition, as it is not realistic to develop simulators for every situation, real deployment must be accompanied with data collected in real life
elements.2211.03267_1ad2f2de6419446223b498742c91b: Therefore, it is important to minimize the data cost needed to train an agent, to ease the transition from sim to real
elements.2211.03267_cba2c7fd02b0495c185ac4eeb33c5: One of the biggest breakthroughs in data efficiency is FILM
elements.2211.03267_848862d26109fb9fa2d55562d6c5e: , as its modular approach eliminated the need for demonstrations of the task by experts
elements.2211.03267_0fd42a7a5c15dcd4fc64cac65d082: Since then, various modules are proposed to improve the performance
elements.2211.03267_4065517ec69573d4676f99f4276fe: , most of which require extra training dataset and increase the deployment cost
elements.2211.03267_7002b2a7f09090a5fe3e453eccbcc: While not all data-hungry modules are bad, they should be evaluated against a data efficient baseline to make sure that the performance increase is worth the effort of collecting extra data
elements.2211.03267_0662bb77605a9fdfe7f790b213371: In this paper, we introduce FILM++, which extends FILM with modifications that do not need extra data, to fill the role of the data efficient baseline
elements.2211.03267_bc164d83842366ea962a841066bdc: Some of the ideas are simplified, data-free versions of the previously proposed modules, in which we encourage researchers to apply their data-hungry counterparts for performance comparisons, while others are based on our careful observations of the EIF problem setting
elements.2211.03267_d883b59d3c3b20aa77f6db76ab89c: As it turns out, FILM++ more than doubles FILM's performance despite the fact that all trained modules are kept constant, indicating that much can be done before requiring extra data
elements.2211.03267_a117ebc149e4b780ca2f5ea94cdb2: Furthermore, we propose Prompter, which replaces the semantic search module of FILM++ with language prompting, making it even more data efficient than FILM++
elements.2211.03267_1782792bdccd340a8cf53229c085d: The semantic search module promotes efficient search by predicting the probable locations of the unobserved objects from the observed ones
elements.2211.03267_d2b1e810a83d2406393bb3b3f589f: trained the module with simulator data, which is problematic for two reasons
elements.2211.03267_88f36b912ccffeb810ff007a29158: First, the module training requires exact coordinate of every object in the scene as annotation
elements.2211.03267_4834ea6029fe88b3b1784680a8a54: Such annotation is easy to collect in a simulator, as attributes of every object can be extracted with a few lines of code, but time-consuming to collect in real life, as a separate data collection process must be administered
elements.2211.03267_7e34f83c0262833a07ea196dc5a8e: Second, in order to minimize the gap between train and deployment, the annotations must represent the
elements.2211.03267_4c04d9d090230dd587ae0861c199e: distribution of the spatial relationships of objects, which can only be captured by examining thousands of rooms where organic human activities have taken place
elements.2211.03267_d70f9873359486ea47c3928c6e676: The random object placement by a simulator or artificial rooms prepared by a small group of people will likely form distinctly different, biased distributions
elements.2211.03267_25414053fb5960204da44691a3e94: As language models are pretrained on a much larger and diverse training data, Prompter's semantic search module is both free of data collection and less likely to overfit to a specific distribution
elements.2211.03267_bea06cb577ecdfb2cd4f993383482: with step-by-step instructions, outperforming the state of the art by 6.57
elements.2211.03267_5c7eeffeb01497d8f1917572338d0: There are many publications related to vision and language tasks, including Vision Language Navigation (VLN) in which agents are tasked to navigate through unknown environments using language input and visual feedback
elements.2211.03267_325228f1d41242affa7bb7d363b37: , and Embodied Question Answering (EQA) in which agents must answer questions about their surroundings
elements.2211.03267_e854610caf3756e2e9e03baa32d49: Unlike VLN and EQA, EIF requires an agent to execute multiple subtasks in one run, many of which involve interactions with the environment, making EIF a challenging task.
elements.2211.03267_e5c6d20283734bf7f3c2c0025a878: This paper will focus on ALFRED, a popular EIF benchmark
elements.2211.03267_0c247967f642e76c1ac269b197277: Early attempts on ALFRED trained single end-to-end models
elements.2211.03267_d4f4ce27ae6379b59b09d3934020f: trained a Seq2Seq model with an attention mechanism
elements.2211.03267_1a89f0bc713aadce1118d71f2d2d6: Since then, modular approaches have been explored, with most equipped with front-end vision and language modules that process raw inputs which are then integrated in the back-end decision making module
elements.2211.03267_ef0357bd89f495d583a9e1f1ef34b: Most methods have a similar front-end setup that organizes the processed information in a form of a semantic map for the back-end
elements.2211.03267_1801be94e60d027bc35f60a0c2d50: However, as this map is built with partial and erroneous observations of the environment, the back-end module must be carefully designed to appropriately select information, and this is where the differences between methods arise
elements.2211.03267_504176008cbba58bea9acbfe39e97: implement it as a trainable module
elements.2211.03267_f7a79fcd30887e976c9901ae2a6dd: add the semantic search module to complement the partial information
elements.2211.03267_9799220194a83c58e6e57b0311d4e: invest first half of each run for information gathering, so that the map is as complete as possible
elements.2211.03267_b47bbb3ef9fd8502b7e2cd1106f1b: In this paper, we propose a more deployment-friendly semantic search module, based on prompting off-the-shelf large language models (LLMs)
elements.2211.03267_db89f3fe1480dc9eab88198ba201d: Prompting LLMs was first proposed by Petroni
elements.2211.03267_64065bee86b843e7ee8f1cc85757c: , and the key concept is to take advantage of the mask-filling capability of LLMs by inputting sentences with the wanted information masked out
elements.2211.03267_17a05ec843a73ad08aa3dde7cf921: For example, if one wants to know the capital of Japan, an input
elements.2211.03267_a592304fd211a82dd203b76d3d806: The LLM fills the mask with the wanted information, in this case
elements.2211.03267_b4ab2ac87610c3e525e8195dd7a75: We use prompting to extract the likelihood of object pairs collocating together, which is then used to guide the object search.
elements.2211.03267_319149c5465a0f8f7c2a0e73da68f: All experiments are conducted on the ALFRED benchmark
elements.2211.03267_a3a071e2a9e0c02a91b50f7a3f308: , in which a mobile manipulation robot is given natural language instructions to complete long-horizon tasks of typically longer than 70 steps
elements.2211.03267_c5622f25264adaf83fff6751f4ce7: The ALFRED benchmark is built on the AI2-THOR simulator
elements.2211.03267_d8f4315bd4ebfcb59efda4ab5f391: , an interactive environment simulating a regular American household
elements.2211.03267_2a7d84bde6579f9afebcc6d8ec8df: As such, tasks in ALFRED are limited to household chores, such as cutting apples and cooking via microwave.
elements.2211.03267_483650bd1069443e952da24417b10: The ALFRED benchmark provides language inputs of two granularities- high-level instructions summarizing the task, and low-level step-by-step instructions
elements.2211.03267_f876df2d74c98a6440693f3a34971: At each time step, an agent makes one action from five navigation actions (RotateRight, RotateLeft, MoveAhead, LookUp, LookDown) or seven object interaction actions (PickupObject, PutObject, OpenObject, CloseObject, ToggleObjectOn, ToggleObjectOff, SliceObject)
elements.2211.03267_2b56afd209f73d7b82eeabcc6fe02: The navigation actions are constrained to discrete values (rotations, move ahead, and look actions are discretized by 90
elements.2211.03267_dada924c3b0d2703c4a168a6112a5: , respectively), and the manipulation actions must be accompanied by an image mask specifying the location of the interaction target in the agent's view
elements.2211.03267_802b12fdfe470988ca679131115a3: ends when the task is finished, 1000 steps are taken, or 10 bad interactions (
elements.2211.03267_18e4863c23eb958585d1ede95a3da: collisions, interacting with non-interactive object) occur.
elements.2211.03267_41853513f1e8eb590a3dd78541fe9: shows the overview of the proposed system
elements.2211.03267_40c7ba7e41d5362323abcff59d409: It consists of two substreams that process the raw inputs and the motion controller that integrates the information for action planning
elements.2211.03267_6a9d9aff321f1b3e42d8073ac525e: In the following sections, we will first briefly review FILM which we base our proposal, proceeded by modifications made to build FILM++ and Prompter.
elements.2211.03267_30f005854d7837a43bf1cfa25b88a: The language substream subdivides the language instructions into a series of object-action pairs, which serve as subtasks that agents follow to complete the task in divide-and-conquer manner
elements.2211.03267_2db718efe544b9841257bd9920222: For example, an object-action pair (Faucet, ToggleObjectOn) corresponds to first finding a faucet and then turning the knob
elements.2211.03267_934518a711bf159c2608d22a0e8a9: The contents and the order of the object-action pairs are templated for the seven tasks types available in ALFRED
elements.2211.03267_49c830b0a07771500557bc6268475: For example, "examine in light" task is always converted to (Obj1, PickupObject), (FloorLamp, ToggleObjectOn), in which the task types and object names are predicted by the language processing module.
elements.2211.03267_940fd8939fa78ab37f9797ff6e88d: The aim of the vision substream is to create a 2D top-down map of the obstacles and objects (semantic map)
elements.2211.03267_8a893d5e7a4b36a967995a6d775a2: At each time step, it receives an egocentric image which is processed into a depth map via UNet
elements.2211.03267_6dee86304105f6b0e5d60f63d3eb9: and an instance segmentation via Mask R-CNN
elements.2211.03267_d7b14d04965957bcfe82320f6d22f: As in FILM, we use models trained by Blukis
elements.2211.03267_b83ee51656098191ba5fa287b9e8c: The two estimations are integrated as a semantic 3D point cloud and converted to an allocentric 2D semantic map
elements.2211.03267_b8b4e2f34db0ed498447fee0d98c0: The resulting semantic map has the dimension
elements.2211.03267_a1546c1c69efd2b4f10895090efcd: is the number of object categories plus one for the obstacle information and
elements.2211.03267_ae6a42194517ced832222a814a916: corresponds to the floor space, each cell representing 5cm
elements.2211.03267_7b9aa96f0ed59810562102669f28e: Given the processed information from the substreams, the motion controller plans the next action
elements.2211.03267_67efee370ea48f711f4a438ee11fd: First, one of three goal planners is chosen in order to determine the next location the agent should visit
elements.2211.03267_854992d92d40917ace361462ca371: The planner selection process is fully deterministic- (1) if the target object is within sight, the local adjustment module makes final adjustments to prepare the agent for object interaction, (2) if the target is in the semantic map, the semantic map lookup module guides the agent to the stored coordinate, and (3) if the previous two conditions are not met, the semantic search module estimates the location of the target from previous landmark observations (Sec.
elements.2211.03267_bbc1af90e8876b3e10309c4587d6a: Finally, the navigation module plans the next action to realize the goal planner's decision.
elements.2211.03267_baf504be2c3e3e8ebd4d2a7cd3c6b: FILM++ and FILM share the same trained modules; they only differ in deterministic aspects, as we describe in the following sections.
elements.2211.03267_ad05485ad7875f7333b354498b9c8: In ALFRED, agents can only make 90
elements.2211.03267_2de9e02460feb9d5a390cf0d67010: turns or 25 cm steps to navigate, which means that only specific locations in the environment can be visited, visualized by a grid of 25 cm intervals
elements.2211.03267_c48a54faf9ff68e72d819999514e8: for navigation, but as FMM assumes that an agent is able to take steps of any size in any direction, it may not be possible for ALFRED agents to follow the path planned by FMM
elements.2211.03267_e21be83c6139ce18531457c7e92b8: Therefore, it is better to formulate navigation under a discrete assumption as done by Murray
elements.2211.03267_f23bb0a75b93c7afa5d334b3c4366: The environment is discretized into a grid of
elements.2211.03267_0a8e02a355cc2c223f07fad175bd8: corresponds to the floor space and
elements.2211.03267_a1d0b2879e68ddb784266c3d91322: is the yaw angle of the agent
elements.2211.03267_4d139e228d284ca601270fdb24ca7: After grid node connectivity is determined from the obstacle prediction, a shortest path solver plans the next step.
elements.2211.03267_c413b8667356d7a38d6c5b98030fe: An agent can only interact with objects that are currently visible and reachable
elements.2211.03267_2c78be1d9ce407911ea4024333582: In ALFRED, an object is considered reachable if its horizontal displacement from the agent is less than 1.5 meters
elements.2211.03267_a4cbee9c349f9e0444432fc7347b2: FILM directly uses the depth estimation to determine the reachability, which is suboptimal as depth includes the height displacement between the camera and the object
elements.2211.03267_3c061423c5e8e73a331b041867541: FILM++ removes the height component from the depth estimation using camera pose, allowing it to accurately judge reachability.
elements.2211.03267_6208c25beda892210368c6c6072ce: An agent must be close enough to an object for a successful interaction, but being too close to an object can also be a source of error
elements.2211.03267_50c30b58606a0518fcb322c02aac7: This is especially true when objects change shape after interaction, as agents may get in the way of deformation
elements.2211.03267_79cbbb9ca437b34086df95914a7e8: proposes a module specifically to care for this type of problem
elements.2211.03267_4b87e00f44094a885b0bce0e9769d: While their module is shown effective, an extra training data with human-in-the-loop is necessary
elements.2211.03267_4a28881c5e2b0eec7f5a7069959bf: We instead propose to offset the agent from the object by 50 cm for the OpenObject action, as it is the only deforming interaction in ALFRED.
elements.2211.03267_8f35e2124cb00bc1d1ae69e96e1e4: The ALFRED benchmark contains the SliceObject action, which typically requires the agent to cut something, put away the knife, and deliver the sliced contents somewhere
elements.2211.03267_96619a7a14cdf55c35791e00ccd52: In FILM++, the agent location and the object mask during slicing event is stored so that the agent can efficiently return for a pick up later.
elements.2211.03267_56dbc095e1048b3d45d468ba23774: FILM++ instructs the agent to look around the environment at the beginning of an episode, to promote information gathering
elements.2211.03267_7c48f73f5a92fa48cce4a208ea84b: take a similar approach, but they use the first 500 steps to gather information, making the average episode duration extremely long
elements.2211.03267_2d12268f0c80b60877c345471733f: Our look around sequence is only 11 steps long, consisting of three LookUp, three RotateLeft, three LookDown, two RotateRight, in that order (agents start an episode with camera angle of 45
elements.2211.03267_349321f5b9d1501a8a10ea88e12c8: below the horizon, and three LookUps equates to looking up by 45
elements.2211.03267_305b306782a017e2f4d170b366044: A common practice during collision-free path planning is to enlarge the obstacles by the size of the agent, so that the agent can be modeled as a point
elements.2211.03267_3c12fbad73239da16cf28ed2fe234: As an agent in ALFRED is shaped as a cylinder of radius 20 cm, we enlarge the obstacles by a conservative 22.5 cm to account for the agent size, unlike 10 cm as done in FILM.
elements.2211.03267_b11ef5ff503e2d6af5583891de983: As agents spend much of their time searching for objects, an efficient search is desired
elements.2211.03267_80836aba44492e44098b01a3763e4: In many of the recent work, the semantic search module, which predicts the location of the target object from the observed objects, is implemented to expedite the search
elements.2211.03267_1cc29c69fab4461012f8a8d9b67bb: The module is based on the idea that because certain object pairs are more likely to collocate, observed objects can act as landmarks to guide the search process
elements.2211.03267_6036e9143b5d8346d10d5257164f6: For example, when searching for a fork, one should search near a sink and not near a toilet
elements.2211.03267_8556212fdd3fb7bc2a77302848f49: In general, larger immovable objects function better as landmarks, as they are easier to spot and less likely to be in arbitrary locations
elements.2211.03267_b45cf43624e44d8481e741c265c3f: We use the same list of landmark objects as in FILM
elements.2211.03267_cab8813b0938592d17bb5dd706ba1: , a major drawback of the previous implementations of semantic search module is that an extra dataset is needed for training
elements.2211.03267_fed434e258a6cde354bb54e622073: This increases the deployment cost and make the model prone to overfit to a distribution different from the
elements.2211.03267_fc36752cb891f96f0701e017f940e: We propose a semantic search module based on language model prompting
elements.2211.03267_870896785bda1c41eda5b059d45ee: First, probabilities of each object pair collocating is calculated by prompting (
elements.2211.03267_2de7c02b51d8fbe4619f1fc33758a: Then the probability is multiplied with the semantic map to produce the object location prediction
elements.2211.03267_b4c07889a8a3fa1072afa47be48a8: Our method has three benefits: first, the pretrained nature removes the data collection bottleneck, second, the fact that LLMs are pretrained with large corpus remedies the data bias problem, and finally, it can easily be extended to adapt new objects, making it friendly to new environments
elements.2211.03267_b23ff98b4bfc409a4ed342ccaee57: Note that these prompts are almost directly taken from the Open Mind Common Sense dataset
elements.2211.03267_aa3c6ee7f971166d069fb1f146f49: , which was published years before LLM prompting was proposed, and thus they are not optimized for prompting; devising an optimal set of prompts is left for future work
elements.2211.03267_3a1eedb3b2aa1570ead51f7d7df66: , where [X] is filled with the name of the object to find, and LLMs fill [Y] with landmark names
elements.2211.03267_ca50d2d3445416c28835404d5a395: To adapt the method for collocation information extraction, we made two modifications
elements.2211.03267_128467b6dfcc881d24f789a841238: First, some object names in AI2-THOR such as
elements.2211.03267_28d0bdd040d9f25dace6fa04c4cf8: are unnaturally phrased, resulting in disproportionately low scores
elements.2211.03267_8400ac155aaa1f36666df1315d5fe: As such, object names are rephrased by forward and backward language translation
elements.2211.03267_bded5dfc055d4a097d0e382f33d96: , similar to how prompts were rephrased by Jiang
elements.2211.03267_cde96a3542b022c80599a48369f8a: The rephrased word is chosen from the top five candidates, to avoid different objects mapping to the same name.
elements.2211.03267_ccc0bf8c42ea128d1ff0b5868779e: Another problem with calculating collocation probability is comparing names of different token lengths
elements.2211.03267_77d57186ce660d128034d1a5b74a7: Because LLMs output one probability score per token, words composed of multiple tokens receive multiple probabilities, making comparisons difficult
elements.2211.03267_fd22515e710d30201458904f31acb: For example, let us evaluate if it is more likely to find an apple near a kitchen counter or a microwave
elements.2211.03267_d410c79b95d69682b8d2e58d9ec4f: For the sake of argument, assume that
elements.2211.03267_4fae93baeaa29e50ab922467142e2: In this case, two prompts must be used-
elements.2211.03267_154fcbc231a59f44c4414091ef03d: Something you find at [MASK] [MASK] is apple.
elements.2211.03267_aefa271605645355fc56f0daa7450: Something you find at [MASK] is apple.
elements.2211.03267_29292dc55ce4466c2fef5474768ec: Since LLM predictions are made per mask token, two probabilities will be produced for kitchen counter, one measuring
elements.2211.03267_c00bcd31c159cc657eb828e47be08: to be in the first mask, and another measuring
elements.2211.03267_ca563a5a23490baeb0ee6388cb7dc: to be in the second mask, whereas only one probability will be outputted for microwave
elements.2211.03267_47cb7ec74c13b4d50dcbb500d9ae9: Empirical studies have shown that aggregating the probability outputs of the multi-token word via multiplication is inadequate
elements.2211.03267_5c1ede1dfc13a925c06065001780f: This is a well-known issue about prompting, and many researches circumvent it by only extracting single token vocabularies
elements.2211.03267_9b4e677a68167c8d82ff85339476b: This issue is observed in our case as well-
elements.2211.03267_3b713438fe97657ac829b1dd26ee6: shows the collocation log-probabilities of the landmarks, averaged across all objects
elements.2211.03267_9f7ab96e35df3f94549b0a7812d4a: In other words, higher the log-probability, more objects are likely to be found near that landmark.
elements.2211.03267_ca8f33bdabac357c07146b4cfdbde: shows that the number of tokens significantly influences the collocation probability regardless of an object's ability as a landmark
elements.2211.03267_116c76b7b460b4a6061cb67f91460: We remedy this issue by calculating the reference score of each landmark
elements.2211.03267_84dd165c17d4a9270c25b82cf7f99: The reference score is calculated by using the same prompts, but filling [X] with a random word, in our case
elements.2211.03267_2d3d8c62285f181b85aaebf8b94e1: , with the aim of quantifying the prior probability of the landmarks
elements.2211.03267_c486a6f1893e7f91da96aa110356f: The collocation scores are then normalized by their respective reference scores.
elements.2211.03267_5da180991fd0a9b2822fcd34c2e89: shows that the normalization subdues the effect of token length
elements.2211.03267_8908b859e0658290e13c08dab9246: The collocation distribution is multiplied with the semantic map prediction to obtain the prediction of probable target location
elements.2211.03267_6c966987f538dd8407fa5b922516b: Finally, in order to balance exploration and exploitation, the goal coordinate is determined by argmax 50
elements.2211.03267_ec2819b0d33bd7c083447525062a1: The ALFRED benchmark consists of tests seen (1533 episodes), tests unseen (1529 episodes), valid seen (820 episodes), and valid unseen (821 episodes) sets
elements.2211.03267_c62b96e13080ba5178df3ba376dd4: Seen/unseen denotes whether rooms also appear in the training set
elements.2211.03267_d819f1f24e5f956893d39dd774743: As for the evaluation metrics, Success Rate (SR) measures whether all subtasks are completed
elements.2211.03267_93b7ed2ad5bdc917b5f1dc51ec106: Goal Condition Success (GC) measures the ratio of subtasks completed in an episode
elements.2211.03267_1e8f2f8cc4246ff63e5aa4e4548fe: Both metrics are weighted by (path length of the expert trajectory)/(path length taken by the agent) to produce path length weighted SR (PLWSR) and path length weighted GC (PLWGC), quantifying how efficiently tasks are completed.

elements.2211.03267_35b591e0c2371fac2fca36b4d2625: We proposed FILM++ and Prompter, two methods for EIF
elements.2211.03267_6db4b78cb3cef51d958e15f87ccaf: FILM++ is an augmented version of FILM, with simple yet effective modifications
elements.2211.03267_c8d6fd06c49bc6c9edca7a0b9fccb: Despite the fact that the trained modules are kept untouched, FILM++ more than doubles FILM's performance
elements.2211.03267_1c4a6ae23eff5ac21e250fab6d681: In Prompter, we proposed a semantic search module that utilizes large language models to estimate the location of the searching object, making the method more data efficient while keeping the performance
elements.2211.03267_bd57e8004818ee9e95bf390022668: Finally, an evaluation on ALFRED revealed that Prompter significantly outperforms the previous state of the art.
elements.2211.03267_6a601de4d427075991a46d1463d6c: Embodied Instruction Following (EIF) studies how autonomous mobile manipulation robots should be controlled to accomplish long-horizon tasks described by natural language instructions
elements.2211.03267_dfe47546e8d8820144908eb2b55a7: While much research on EIF is conducted in simulators, the ultimate goal of the field is to deploy the agents in real life.
elements.2211.03267_7b9ea12f1009677237a5063f98eb1: This is one of the reasons why recent methods have moved away from training models end-to-end and take modular approaches, which do not need the costly expert operation data
elements.2211.03267_3515a18a13273d26819fc1dd5a296: However, as it is still in the early days of importing modular ideas to EIF, a search for modules effective in the EIF task is still far from a conclusion
elements.2211.03267_5d750ccefd7664429d9e1270c46ce: In this paper, we propose to extend the modular design using knowledge obtained from two external sources
elements.2211.03267_0e06bbc8c1ee6533051038f4b5440: First, we show that embedding the physical constraints of the deployed robots into the module design is highly effective
elements.2211.03267_9ceacd61df7fa59e38021a3eda882: Our design also allows the same modular system to work across robots of different configurations with minimal modifications
elements.2211.03267_60a6a7cc9dfb249fd3223e99512ae: Second, we show that the landmark-based object search, previously implemented by a trained model requiring a dedicated set of data, can be replaced by an implementation that prompts pretrained large language models for landmark-object relationships, eliminating the need for collecting dedicated training data
elements.2211.03267_1aa43feaf40d0746a3fae54800c89: on the ALFRED benchmark with high-level instructions only and step-by-step instructions, respectively, significantly outperforming the previous state of the art by 5.46
elements.2211.03267_3f8a83fc368dea0b77f0ec51c7515: The code will be released upon acceptance.
elements.2211.03267_56adad8e3b9a26f8a668b693c4d50: The development of autonomous agents that can follow language instructions has long been one of mankindâs dreams
elements.2211.03267_8d0e6526a481ef8ff84779d1f2997: Embodied Instruction Following (EIF) studies just that- mobile agents are given natural language instructions to perform long-horizon tasks involving both navigation and interactions with the environment
elements.2211.03267_5852b963a4d7d9a88cef3d8115917: Unlike similar tasks in the field of embodied intelligence, EIF requires agents to not only navigate unseen environments but also interact with the environments
elements.2211.03267_d8061549b489ce83a8c7402030d7d: This makes variations in tasks, language instructions, and the action space that agents must handle significantly more complex
elements.2211.03267_64d5fb5f8feeb72b3f45c3a7388a5: As a result, EIF is considered one of the most human-like and challenging tasks.
elements.2211.03267_894d6007ba30d329c386d4fca1b78: Most early attempts in EIF trained end-to-end models using imitation learning
elements.2211.03267_f6e28058ccfefc11d0106c6b53869: , but because imitation learning is relatively data-hungry and requires expert trajectory data, they were eventually replaced by modular approaches which are both sample-efficient and high performing
elements.2211.03267_2af169d1616f1ce87ad38a50886c1: As the ultimate goal of EIF is to deploy agents in real life, this switch to reduce the data cost and ease the sim-to-real transition is only natural
elements.2211.03267_b4f5e244788be2708e73c203a0801: , but most require extra training data which partially negates the sample efficiency of modular approaches
elements.2211.03267_a49217bcb945bf78374274bf1e03b: In this work, we propose Prompter, which extends previous modular EIF systems with knowledge obtained from external sources
elements.2211.03267_2601f68c77f166ca14cc51ba7ff28: First source of knowledge is the physical constraints of the agents, such as their dimensions and physical capabilities
elements.2211.03267_eacfcd203f27e0539cfdb0a54d647: One tricky aspect of EIF is that it involves interactions with the environment, so it is critical to incorporate the agent's physical constraints to the modular design
elements.2211.03267_c3f4942c1d4718ad8dd8007211698: While this seems like a basic idea, many EIF studies have overlooked this point
elements.2211.03267_4263753c4b0fdd3870c763f4d25ae: We show that a significant performance improvement can be achieved from this point alone
elements.2211.03267_72dd95384e08a2ee3dd0302e9e285: In addition to the performance gain, as robot's physical constraints are easily obtainable in any real or simulator environment, our modules can be easily customized for agents of different configurations
elements.2211.03267_5c30818087dd993fb83efaad94ae9: Second source of knowledge is the pretrained large language models (LLMs)
elements.2211.03267_bfae7af003e72d2e763f17ebe674e: It has been shown empirically that by using appropriately formatted prompts, common sense information can be retrieved from LLMs
elements.2211.03267_8719d966a30ad35ccaecca0634b94: , and some studies have successfully applied the retrieved information in robotic settings
elements.2211.03267_64bb1cf07f6852241fb3f7a711f9d: The greatest benefit of LLM prompting is that it can be done in a zero-shot manner, requiring no extra data for fine-tuning
elements.2211.03267_3ba3922f35b410930bdda2e190d47: However, unlike previous studies which apply LLM prompting for zero-shot image recognition
elements.2211.03267_56fe32983058f5f99c2c736ee3629: , we propose to utilize it for landmark-based object search, which is a module that predicts the locations of the unobserved objects from the locations of the observed landmark objects
elements.2211.03267_a7ccc6c6ea1ca3608e59137ee096c: Landmark-based search has been shown to be effective in EIF tasks
elements.2211.03267_0d45836a76b7743fd08c3f7051423: , but the module is implemented by a model trained on a dedicated dataset, which is not data-efficient and also prone to simulator bias
elements.2211.03267_16f197c00f39c472c8cabfaf2e0f1: By implementing the module with LLM prompting, we realize zero-shot prediction.
elements.2211.03267_caa88034e1e7d99c0460326a0983e: To summarize, our contributions are three-fold: (1) We propose Prompter, a modular approach to the EIF task that incorporates external knowledge sources such as agents' physical constraints
elements.2211.03267_ecdfa04471770389370c1f16bdc8d: Although physical constraints information have been used implicitly in previous EIF research, to our knowledge this is the first study that explicitly examines their effect
elements.2211.03267_103591a04858bfd07b0181b586c65: We also believe that by explicitly listing how each constraint is used, it can act as a
elements.2211.03267_f8d3083805fc9b5c090e3b9ace367: that others in the field can adopt in their task setting. (2) We also propose to utilize LLMs as a source of external knowledge, to implement landmark-based object search in a zero-shot manner
elements.2211.03267_64d9c5666ea4308f66193b5db3aaf: To our knowledge, this is the first attempt to utilize LLMs for extracting inter-object relationships, and we show that it has the potential to match the performance of the models trained on dedicated datasets. (3) We evaluate Prompter on ALFRED
elements.2211.03267_4cced91ca25786f8df24ff25b308d: , one of the most challenging EIF benchmarks, and show that it outperforms the previous state of the art by significant margins.
elements.2211.03267_2f72bed3046cf56ee56460fc561a4: There are many tasks in the field of embodied intelligence, including Vision Language Navigation (VLN) in which agents are tasked to navigate through unknown environments using language input and visual feedback
elements.2211.03267_a0f66f2690599a3a8aaa9756fed2b: Our proposed Prompter is evaluated on the ALFRED benchmark
elements.2211.03267_969ba3728f8878b1a3a36eda3187d: ALFRED is one of the only EIF benchmarks that requires the deployed agents to handle variety of task types, interaction actions, and object state changes (
elements.2211.03267_b03c15672bb406e2630582b8f6e99: temperature, cleanliness), making it one of the most realistic EIF benchmarks
elements.2211.03267_f9fac582f94b33d85926ac58735d0: Furthermore, it boasts one of the most active communities with a competitive public leaderboard
elements.2211.03267_b950dbe1462f31de6ec084f4df8b6: , while others trained variations of transformers
elements.2211.03267_514f6c41fa7f5685a9fe6ef5945ba: Recently, modular approaches have been explored, with most equipped with front-end vision and language modules that process raw inputs and a back-end decision-making module that integrates the processed information
elements.2211.03267_571dac8e71af1ef22933e7553e30f: In many implementations, the visual information is organized in the form of semantic map, which summarizes the locations of the observed object instances as a top-down view of the scene
elements.2211.03267_7fb1d3682fd4869e7895cbb9d666a: However, as this map is built with partial and erroneous observations of the environment, the decision-making module must be carefully designed, giving rise to the differences among the methods
elements.2211.03267_65bd1432b7095fe7abf2c8fed8c25: In this paper, we propose a module based on prompting off-the-shelf LLMs
elements.2211.03267_a22cf73c2ed2e76ab2bddcedb5a06: Prompting is based on the idea that because LLMs are trained to complete sentences, desired information can be retrieved by providing an LLM with partially-completed sentences
elements.2211.03267_7eee1b1f6c6e750e3a5e3bbdcfb9b: For example, if one wants to know the capital of Japan, an incomplete sentence
elements.2211.03267_527a4466de803350fac4e40cc6f96: The query result is obtained by checking how LLM ends the sentence
elements.2211.03267_3f385501bbee7561da811dceb4a1d: Because LLMs are trained on huge corpus that are subject agnostic, LLMs are empirically shown to be effective source of general knowledge without any domain specific fine-tuning
elements.2211.03267_de323c30ffae22efd7e7a1ff803b3: Due to the high generality and a relatively high performance, pretrained large language models are starting to be utilized in the field of embodied intelligence
elements.2211.03267_05811db8f20587c5a79876f1ec957: For example, few studies use LLMs to decompose the high-level language instructions into low-level step-by-step instructions
elements.2211.03267_f3065df05e527b44e7a0dc6d53ffe: Others use models such as CLIP
elements.2211.03267_d94902607d7308c4827709248129a: that can map vision and language information to the same embedding space to realize zero-shot object detection and instance segmentation
elements.2211.03267_c98a1f85266e6166094430f332484: How we utilize LLMs differs from the previous methods in that we use LLMs to quantify how likely it is for a pair of objects to collocate, and use the information to expedite the object search process
elements.2211.03267_d4c1cdd457d254b501504f44ec553: In previous studies, this is achieved by training a dedicated model on a separate dataset
elements.2211.03267_fcee5c48b72548d75f4c2a646bab7: , but because LLM prompting is zero-shot, our method significantly increases the data-efficiency of the whole system.
elements.2211.03267_fff079f3c73632c110902003921dc: , which is a task based on the iTHOR simulartor
elements.2211.03267_e46840243f7ba631ce010ee02ebad: where a mobile manipulation robot must complete long-horizon tasks described by natural language instructions
elements.2211.03267_667fb9546b027c718533533c69a46: with no information of the surrounding environment

elements.2211.03267_1391936faf9c4aec28c49e60e7b2a: shows the overview of the proposed method
elements.2211.03267_e04027868a8f5832352467c0b35df: First, the free-form language instructions provided at the beginning of an episode and the raw RGB images captured by the agent's camera at each time step are processed by the two perception modules
elements.2211.03267_aef56c01f4960f82003550249db4a: Then, the motion controller integrates the processed information as well as the external information such as the physical constraints of the agent and the LLM to decide the next action
elements.2211.03267_53bff989c3522642c47fe49ab8944: Some works implement the motion controller as a data-driven module
elements.2211.03267_6b1bf6d297aead9bd04004bef4d8d: , but data-driven controllers have a major drawback that they require expert trajectory data for training, which is precisely the reason why modular approaches were selected over end-to-end models to begin with
elements.2211.03267_891e14d94c64afe6fb8627017a015: Furthermore, the controller implicitly learns the physical constraints of the robot, which is undesired as it locks the controller to one specific robot configuration
elements.2211.03267_99c1c60c5fc5ca4aa4833fcfcd6b8: Instead of implicitly incorporating the physical constraints into the controller through training, they should be explicitly configurable, as this information is easily obtainable in any environment
elements.2211.03267_835f7b8d7818cc9d4b7466249316c: Other works implement the motion controller as rule-based modules like we do in Prompter, but fail to properly incorporate the physical constraints, resulting in sub-optimal performance results.
elements.2211.03267_79b91a1c593c44dbfb62432fff7e2: From the next subsections, we will detail how external knowledge are reflected in the module design.
elements.2211.03267_2d0788eae9b1f5cd373eaf91dcf9e: design of the perception modules without any modifications.
elements.2211.03267_deecc2e4078f47735ef1d1356b80f: The language module decomposes the language instructions into a sequence of object-action pairs, which serve as subtasks that agents follow to complete a task in divide-and-conquer manner
elements.2211.03267_e8bceb93927cd3b1d07aeba33a830: For each object-action pair in the sequence, the agent first searches for the object, and once the object is found, performs the action
elements.2211.03267_2defcd2b0309d43d34a2d13af9ff1: is a placeholder replaced depending on the contents of the language instruction
elements.2211.03267_3b5c3329d861b1a0cc03918a7f899: The task types and the object names are predicted at the beginning of an episode, by several instances of BERTs
elements.2211.03267_8306278975d6d9b8caec806060146: The aim of the vision module is to process the egocentric RGB image captured at each time step, and accumulate the information as a 2D top-down map of all observed objects in the scene
elements.2211.03267_cbec5a8d42fc43ce848f0129d4bc7: This map, named the semantic map, represents the agent's understanding of the surrounding environment
elements.2211.03267_e3f066c9969a7f93721b2e7270b2b: First, the egocentric image is processed into a depth map via UNet
elements.2211.03267_24c4027af531fbdf367c308901f98: and an instance segmentation mask via Mask R-CNN
elements.2211.03267_11baa24536cd9eb8baaf0197e2017: The depth estimation model trained by Blukis
elements.2211.03267_d1ae6df5f3fe7de15259a79d04097: and the instance segmentation model trained by Shridhar
elements.2211.03267_7125dcde2a022823077399ac62e22: corresponds to the floor space, each cell representing 5 cm
elements.2211.03267_064d5e2feb6fccab75ccedc92e74b: The motion planner receives the processed information from the perception modules and plans the next action
elements.2211.03267_b52380c88f14868b22d2e72cc9105: The motion controller first selects the goal planner which plans the next action
elements.2211.03267_1df626343b16c96f270f68e77c265: The planner selection process is fully deterministic- (1) if the target object is within sight, the local adjustment module makes final adjustments to prepare the agent for object interaction (Sec.
elements.2211.03267_45b7a3c01bb05eb95591796a5d95b: ), (2) if the target is in the semantic map, the semantic map lookup module guides the agent to the appropriate coordinate, and (3) if the previous two conditions are not met, the semantic search module estimates the location of the target from the observed landmark locations (Sec.
elements.2211.03267_cb1c3a7b4c692c310495cc1351496: Finally, the navigation module calculates a collision-free path to the coordinate specified by the goal planner (Sec.
elements.2211.03267_bf51cdb2952d1e2df5001048c363c: The local adjustment module is selected when the target object is within the agent's sight
elements.2211.03267_2de77741b9b2da622399c01652dc3: It decides if the agent is ready to interact with the target, and if not, relocates it to prepare for the interaction
elements.2211.03267_d3f36e7bde81e291df494332d8482: Needless to say, an object must be reachable from the agent for it to be interactable
elements.2211.03267_07823f4a9bef677c45dec115f8d5a: Two pieces of information are needed to judge if the agent can reach the target object, notably (1) relative position between the target and the agent and (2) given a coordinate, whether the agent have the ability to reach
elements.2211.03267_f5c7655d71a50f020510bf714d376: The relative position can be calculated by first determining the object location in the camera coordinate system by combining the depth and the instance segmentation predictions, and then converting it to the world coordinate system using the camera position and orientation
elements.2211.03267_aac9feb4dd07ba9072ba6f07a4ccf: On the other hand, an agent's ability to reach a specific coordinate can be measured prior to the start of the task and supplied as an external knowledge.
elements.2211.03267_51d9ee510afd0ee095b7d2a7698b5: Another point of consideration is the distance between the agent and the target object during interactions
elements.2211.03267_a20b4b3a30398f9ac431687924701: In general, it is better to interact with objects at a closer distance, since the vision module tend to be more accurate and object manipulation is also easier
elements.2211.03267_fcb57272cf4e2861579e2fb8a262a: However, this is not be the case for actions that modify the shape of the target, as agents may interfere with the deformed object

elements.2211.03267_4d2a01da68d3ef63055071fd65c71: For the cases in which such information is available before the task starts, it should be supplied as external knowledge to appropriately position the agent
elements.2211.03267_1c570ebce8291b1adb7aaacdc570c: To summarize, this module uses three pieces of external knowledge related to physical constraints- camera pose, agent's reachability and action consequences
elements.2211.03267_35bbb2dc788947f220d358ed37141: In ALFRED, an agent has a camera at 1.6 m above the ground, and its camera orientation can be obtained from the sensor readings
elements.2211.03267_74041e027579d810645875316ef83: Furthermore, its manipulation arm can reach any objects that are within 1.5 m from the center of the agent
elements.2211.03267_0206738befbd08b5a060e6d342b8a: These pieces of information are used to judge whether the agent is ready for object interaction

elements.2211.03267_ba09f2f44b7566c08ebbfd4af40e2: The navigation module calculates a collision-free path to the coordinate outputted by the goal planners
elements.2211.03267_93a271d6f8a167c7e9fea064dc071: Object collisions can be decomposed into two components, namely the location of obstacles in the scene and the agent size
elements.2211.03267_ead09ce8cbe860ba08ea1c571c16d: In our navigation module, the obstacle information is estimated by the semantic map accumulated in the vision module, and the agent size is provided as the external knowledge
elements.2211.03267_dbc9e55896000ce04c5ddbecb616b: These two pieces of information are integrated by enlarging the obstacle map with the size of the agent, so that the agent can be modeled as a dimensionless object during path calculation
elements.2211.03267_d0d8805e1c8ec7c72a3c0ce7a7a5f: In ALFRED, the agent shape can be modeled as a cylinder of radius 20 cm, so the obstacle map is enlarged by 20 cm before the shortest path solver is applied.
elements.2211.03267_bdc376710e6c6d4a9c2e912cc1ca2: The ALFRED benchmark consists of train (21023 episodes), test-seen (1533 episodes), test-unseen (1529 episodes), val-seen (820 episodes), and val-unseen (821 episodes) sets
elements.2211.03267_dd9db004d4e2a89a4cc38a5f6b281: The seen splits share the same room layouts as the train split, so the unseen split is used to evaluate how well a model generalizes to new environments
elements.2211.03267_333a39e278d67a814ded3326a8e0a: which measures whether all subtasks are completed and
elements.2211.03267_818ceb017cacabf409fec93a2ef90: which measures the ratio of subtasks completed in an episode
elements.2211.03267_2625e061532e53a309f3fa9d6d840: Furthermore, both metrics are weighted by (path length of the expert trajectory)/(path length taken by the agent) to produce
elements.2211.03267_feb93dc2ee3c4ad396204cbbe489f: , quantifying how efficiently tasks are completed.
elements.2211.03267_d90bab5a3ff0d635993666cb06950: Note that the table is separated by the types of the language instructions used by the agents
elements.2211.03267_77356be8aa2464cdcffa6f0350c7e: Prompter achieves state of the art on most metrics for both language types, including the test-unseen SR used in the official leaderboard ranking
elements.2211.03267_4602afe93fd433bcd755e6b477dfa: over previous state of the art, displaying the effectiveness of Prompter
elements.2211.03267_3ab10f6d0f4dd6383d67a6f4c3071: Also note the significant increase in the path length weighted (PLW) metrics between Prompter and EPA, the previous state of the art for the high-level language instructions
elements.2211.03267_bb80776991459c600fc4f9cc9a582: This indicates that Prompter is significantly more efficient, which may become critical in real deployment, as older observations are more likely to get invalidated by other actors in the scene, such as when objects are relocated by humans
elements.2211.03267_7fb5a06abbd25055b69d33db365b4: The only metrics in which Prompter underperforms are the PLW metrics for the test-seen split
elements.2211.03267_d0b75315620a152cc3641d220ba5c: Since Prompter has better SR and GC, it implies that E.T. and LWIT finish the tasks considerably faster, as SR and PLWSR should in general scale together
elements.2211.03267_618c9db9a239d8dfe6bee86eedebe: As landmark objects stay at the same location between the seen splits of train and test, it is possible that these models remembered the landmark locations for a faster task completion
elements.2211.03267_59d59c97fc5804101e7b0eaebf812: Since evaluation on the test split is only available on the leaderboard server, all ablation studies are conducted on the val-unseen split, and all methods are evaluated with high-level instructions only.
elements.2211.03267_28a3785bc73c2c10f86535c5e823d: summarizes how Prompter performs with ground truth language parsing (+ gt lang.), ground truth depth and instance segmentations (+ gt vision), and both (+ gt vision, gt lang.)
elements.2211.03267_99b6df673a6ed0c2f4f2e586ea563: The table shows that while both modules have much room for improvement, the vision module has a larger room for growth, suggesting that the UNet and the Mask R-CNN models used in the vision module may need to be updated so that future studies on ALFRED are not inhibited by inaccurate image processing
elements.2211.03267_e427a7a7a9dbb0815fe6a885b9c07: The table also shows human performance on the test-unseen split
elements.2211.03267_1ca7043073c87d7fa739801cbac53: Though we cannot make a direct comparison between the human performance and the rest of the table since they are evaluated on different splits, we can see that with strong perception modules, the proposed method may start to reach the human performance.

elements.2211.03267_79a5ea0c22898620024af0a464edd: The collocation probability extracted from the LLM is further analyzed to examine how well it captures the inter-object relationship
elements.2211.03267_bd05a9945ecba2a7d67a1740f1ad3: The collocation probability is evaluated from three perspectives: (1) does it assign high scores for landmark-object pairs permitted in the simulator? (2) does it assign high scores for landmarks generally good for placing objects? (3) when objects are hidden inside of landmarks, can it be used to estimate which landmark is most likely hiding the object?
elements.2211.03267_234d1071e4d9b174b2965fe44417a: The first two metrics, Probability Ratio (PR) and Receptacle Ratio (RR), are based on the iTHOR simulator's definition of object-landmark pairs that are allowed to be positioned together
elements.2211.03267_caf5a32b42ecf123feb3acf0296b3: For example, a baseball bat can be placed on a bed, but not in a refrigerator
elements.2211.03267_e5eeb891bc26002193e85cfbf5298: Though not perfect, this definition roughly captures the collocation relationship we want to extract from the LLMs
elements.2211.03267_7b8eb454c9ba82e405ff92515b8f4: ) which takes the mean of the collocation probability for some set of object-landmark pairs
elements.2211.03267_2f791d5f3964874d7ead23ab2ae13: Defining the set of all object-landmark pairs allowed in iTHOR as
elements.2211.03267_2836cd5cef1248163636650aebe7b: Higher PR means that the collocation probability
elements.2211.03267_e0562b842ad52e5d00b5da93a7954: tends to assign higher scores for object-landmark pairs permitted in the simulator
elements.2211.03267_4c66a81e12269ae6f1fa01f8418fc: One of the desired properties of collocation probabilities is to capture which landmarks are generally good for object search
elements.2211.03267_8216705e0a34e6d585187b3ad3163: Such information would provide a good backup plan for the case in which the target object is not found on the initial try
elements.2211.03267_d1933bb69ed02fbfa97ef348c0855: To quantify this point, the 24 landmark objects in ALFRED are sorted by the number of object-landmark pairs that are allowed in the simulator, and the top 25
elements.2211.03267_edc1f97b642ecbbb0e6d17a6d2d39: landmarks are selected to form the set
elements.2211.03267_0f0775e9b5e8dc900c5da5bf07abc: The two metrics are used to evaluate the extracted collocation probabilities, as summarized in
elements.2211.03267_ed9b821f1e850a8b7c516d0dc5f7f: Prompter maintains high scores for both PR and RR, especially against
elements.2211.03267_3b41c1cfd4b45db3a6a7b2babaa95: , which models the collocation probability as a uniform distribution
elements.2211.03267_50ac050f0fe1940902258f832ccd6: We also ablate against different numbers of context samples
elements.2211.03267_432fd75cb36e1108daef53ef3efd1: It shows that as the number of contexts is increased, RR improves while PR stays constant
elements.2211.03267_a4ebdb188a4ba43e9546fa89b356f: We hypothesize that without context samples, LLM does not recognize that the prompt is about object-landmark collocation
elements.2211.03267_68d525254eea70b07cdbf856959fe: As a result, it tends to score high for object-landmark pairs that are conceptually similar, such as book and shelf, but is unable to identify landmarks generally good for object search, such as the countertop
elements.2211.03267_39b6d85b43aea9f6311714ecf9281: The last metric on the table,
elements.2211.03267_0fd7e93dca7ec92eec350cd42ac63: , measures the potential of the LLM prompting to be useful in future works
elements.2211.03267_dca3e8edca114ebe88be032608ec1: One of the issues with most systems in EIF, including Prompter, is that it is impossible to find objects hidden in container-like landmarks
elements.2211.03267_e100129a93610c58eb4ee55a38c56: The difficulty with hidden objects is that the agent must recognize which object is most likely to contain the hidden object
elements.2211.03267_28920087c193e2ee6895bedcc7fab: For example, a basketball should be looked inside a cabinet, not inside a fridge
elements.2211.03267_a2046ffab0c3bec267839c4057c14: We show here that the LLM prompting approach has the potential to be utilized for this purpose
elements.2211.03267_0dc5cd96a9c8efa926d6c2f9ac10e: Of the 24 landmarks, six landmarks that are capable of hiding objects are selected, and from the val-unseen split of ALFRED, we extract the probability distribution of different objects hidden in those six landmarks
elements.2211.03267_2aefc00dd552e99c57003259c66a7: This pseudo-ground truth distribution is compared against the LLM collocation probability via KL divergence to quantify how well the LLM collocation probability estimates the locations of the hidden objects.
elements.2211.03267_29ba7ea59d690e2dd2fa9d3f9ec21: summarizes the result, showing that the LLM prompting is better than a uniform random guess.

elements.2211.03267_00ea00a13f20af2bc61510f3d3e61: The modular framework in EIF is still far from perfect
elements.2211.03267_c02f461458ff33f9cbe875f999e93: In this section, we outline the shortcomings of Prompter as well as the ALFRED task itself and suggest some future directions.
elements.2211.03267_a7338fd2dba4af604773bb1ea53f0: One of the difficulties in EIF is converting free-form language inputs into step-by-step instructions that agents can follow
elements.2211.03267_5808ff4c4fa8978e03a9f1b347942: , Prompter adopts the templated approach proposed by FILM
elements.2211.03267_57b5e6f69f0a7f1552e30b0cc6d65: While this template approach is effective, it gives rise to situations impossible for the agents to handle
elements.2211.03267_532ef869547e4aa1bef5c4ec95372: One major problem is that after the sequence of object-action pairs is fixed at the beginning of each episode, there is no mechanism to update it during the episode
elements.2211.03267_f390c9746afd4b51eb9b80eeee5b2: As a result, it cannot handle the situation in which objects are hidden inside a container, because the
elements.2211.03267_8dd12d39ac7ee50fe8375e7690668: action needed to discover the hidden object cannot be inserted in the sequence
elements.2211.03267_75603b8edb7c90f0b808113cd737c: Another problem is that the object-action pairs can only store object names
elements.2211.03267_77fa12dd7b759f86649ab02e237dd: It strips down any other object attributes specified in the original instruction, such as the color and the location of the object.
elements.2211.03267_0c6c0b1b4fd48da61b53519a68b8b: Therefore, if the scene has multiple instances of the same object type, random instances are selected to complete the tasks, which could be problematic in a real deployment
elements.2211.03267_c2844273e38a8b613309290a3ce34: Unfortunately, most tasks in ALFRED make no distinctions on the specific instance of the objects, leaving this misbehaviour unpunished.
elements.2211.03267_d3c0ba6b02bb317bc21362459e336: For these reasons, future works should avoid templated language processing and develop language modules that can match the expressiveness of free-form instructions and also capable of modifying its policies mid-episode to reflect the situation.
elements.2211.03267_547a52eb9579b26e8454e92403cf3: One of the major drawbacks of any prompting-based method is that LLMs are sensitive to prompt templates
elements.2211.03267_6175c4a0d202d00f11d06640e9818: This has been reported in many studies and is an active field of research
elements.2211.03267_1348281fdacb74069e9bf7b7ff782: In Prompter, the following features must be handcrafted: (1) rephrasing the names of the objects and landmarks to more natural ones (2) assigning prepositions to landmarks (
elements.2211.03267_41ae65f5565e3ddc86f42d20b183e: countertop: on, fridge: in) (3) selecting which objects will be used as landmarks
elements.2211.03267_5aabbb01473f12e0b975f4bfbf799: (4) the query template and the sample contexts
elements.2211.03267_622c8f094f58ad52fccff893c97e2: We do remark that while the four points mentioned above may sound a lot, it is still significantly cheaper than having to prepare a dedicated set of data for training the semantic search module, as previously done.
elements.2211.03267_24bb83af0aa6013ad9d42f2a66472: The iTHOR simulator used by ALFRED provides a variety of scenes, making it an effective testbed for the EIF tasks
elements.2211.03267_79350d94ae2036b45c72109f72a61: However, iTHOR can only instantiate one room at a time, so all episodes in ALFRED take place in a single room, often only half-filled with objects
elements.2211.03267_19c44c749d136a9484ae6182842b0: shows top-down views of the rooms from the val-unseen split of ALFRED, with green and yellow dotted areas corresponding to 5 m
elements.2211.03267_b920006e22534e6a63ff6c08a780f: As the figure shows, most objects in the rooms can be contained in the dotted space, meaning that the regions that agents must search is quite confined
elements.2211.03267_564ada5d321010fa3d802b277f2d0: This significantly limits the opportunity to challenge agents with more complex situations, and it also indicates that the methods tuned in ALFRED may face difficulties when deployed in reality, as most real environments are much larger
elements.2211.03267_1b0b0b3a13fb318af50bede6b98dc: For example, there is a good chance that we are not making accurate comparisons between different semantic search modules, as scenes in iTHOR are too small to properly punish inefficient methods
elements.2211.03267_7d90d77d00d110992f10fb7dbc16e: One way to resolve this issue is to utilize the recent developments in the community to expand iTHOR to generate multiple rooms for agents to explore
elements.2211.03267_016db8dc1bf01170e589c9bfb43ac: , and create an ALFRED-like EIF benchmark in those environments.
elements.2211.03267_422e21c7a42c46b35655421bd408a: We proposed Prompter, which augments the previous modular systems designed for EIF with two sources of external knowledge: (1) physical constraints of the deployed agents (2) LLMs for estimating the location of unobserved objects
elements.2211.03267_d48a9f4162d8ec2d862a56abd38e7: Both modifications require little to no data collection and annotation process, making them friendly to new environments
elements.2211.03267_9a374906fe54af5cc6bc4f1e514bc: Furthermore, they are general enough to be integrated into other EIF tasks as well
elements.2211.03267_93854ef4a40478683488bdeb0436d: Finally, Prompter is evaluated on the ALFRED benchmark and showed that it significantly outperforms the previous state of the art.
